title: Ysgawyn

properties.value: Ysgawyn is one of the many citizens of Lletya. He is located upstairs in Lletya. If players attempt to speak with him, he notifies them he is rather busy at the moment.

Ysgawyn
Released19 July 2005 (Update)

RaceElf
LocationLletya

OptionsTalk-to
ExamineA grumpy elf.
Map
Advanced data
NPC ID5298

Ysgawyn is one of the many citizens of Lletya. He is located upstairs in Lletya. If players attempt to speak with him, he notifies them he is rather busy at the moment.

During Song of the Elves, Ysgawyn acts as a key member of the group of Lletya in working with Arianwyn to work on finding the Elven clan leaders. He bears a strong grudge against Essylt (and his clan) for killing his husband. He criticises the player's capabilities for who would be best to enter the Grand Library, and later the players attempt to confront him about being a traitor to the group. When Arianwyn betrays the group and Lord Iorwerth marches on Lletya, Ysgawyn attempts to attack Essyllt, but is killed by him in the process. He is buried in Lletya before the player and the elves of Lletya continues their endeavor to find the elven clan leaders and stop Lord Iorwerth's plan.

Contents

  • 1 Treasure Trails
  • 2 Changes
    • 2.1 Gallery (historical)
  • 3 Trivia

Treasure Trails[edit | edit source]

Ysgawyn is the solution to the master anagram clue: YAWNS GY. He will then give the player either a light box or a puzzle box.

Changes[edit | edit source]

Date Changes
5 September 2019
(update | poll)

Ysgawyn's chathead was updated again.

25 July 2019
(update)
  • Players can no longer pickpocket Ysgawyn, previously players with 85 Thieving could pickpocket him after starting Mourning's End Part I. A successful pickpocket would yield coins or other items and 353 Thieving experience.
  • Ysgawyn's chathead and model were updated.

Gallery (historical)[edit | edit source]

present

Trivia[edit | edit source]

  • His name means 'name from legends' in Welsh.
  • He is an LGBTQ+ character, as it is revealed by Arianwyn that Ysgawyn previously had a husband.
